intro: Menestoria tocoyenae, commonly known as the Tocoyena menestoria, is a rare and unique plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
